parsed.internal_thinking:
This is the first move of the game (SETUP_FIRST_ROUND), so I need to prioritize a high-yield settlement that provides a good mix of early-game resources (Wood and Brick for roads/settlements, and Sheep for variety). 

Looking at the board, Node 20 stands out. It borders Hex 9 (Wood 11, 2 pips), Hex 5 (Brick 6, 5 pips), and Hex 4 (Sheep 8, 5 pips). This gives a total of 12 pips and covers three essential resources. While Node 43 has a higher total yield (13 pips), it is entirely Wheat (Wh9, Wh6, Wh9), which lacks the diversity needed for a strong start. 

Node 20 is also strategically positioned near other high-yield nodes like 10 (11 pips) and 19 (10 pips), and it's only two steps away from a 3:1 port at Node 9. This provides a clear expansion path. By taking Node 20, I secure the best balanced position on the board before Bob and Charlie can claim it. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Placed first settlement on Node 20 (W11, B6, S8). Strategy: Expand towards Node 19 or Node 9 for the 3:1 port. For the second settlement, prioritize Wheat and Ore (look at Nodes 41, 42, or 43 if they remain available).
parsed.say_outloud: I'll start things off at Node 20. The 6-Brick and 8-Sheep are too good to pass up, and the 11-Wood gives me a nice path toward some early expansion. Good luck everyone!
